member.name: T:System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.BroadcastBlock`1
member.summary: Provides a buffer for storing at most one element at time, overwriting each message with the next as it arrives. Messages are broadcast to all linked targets, all of which may consume a clone of the message.
member.typeparam: Specifies the type of the data buffered by this dataflow block.
member.remarks: exposes at most one element at a time. However, unlike , that element will be overwritten as new elements are provided to the block. ensures that the current element is broadcast to any linked targets before allowing the element to be overwritten.

member.name: T:System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.IDataflowBlock
member.summary: Represents a dataflow block.

member.name: P:System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.IDataflowBlock.CompletionTask
member.summary: Gets a Task that represents the asynchronous operation and completion of the dataflow block.
member.remarks: A dataflow block is considered completed when it is not currently processing a message and when it has guaranteed that it will not process any more messages. The returned Task will transition to a completed state when the associated block has completed. It will transition to the RanToCompletion state when the block completes its processing successfully according to the dataflow block’s defined semantics, it will transition to the Faulted state when the dataflow block has completed processing prematurely due to an unhandled exception, and it will transition to the Canceled state when the dataflow block has completed processing prematurely due to receiving a cancellation request. If the task completes in the Faulted state, its Exception property will return an containing the one or more exceptions that caused the block to fail.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.ITargetBlock`1.Post(`0)
member.summary: Posts an item to the .
member.param: The item being offered to the target.
member.returns: true if the item was accepted by the target block; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method will return once the target block has decided to accept or decline the item, but unless otherwise dictated by special semantics of the target block, it does not wait for the item to actually be processed (for example, will return from Post as soon as it's stored the posted item into its input queue). For target blocks that support postponing offered messages, or for blocks that may do more processing in their Post implementation, consider using PostAsync, which will return immediately and will enable the target to postpone the posted message and later consume it after PostAsync returns.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.BroadcastBlock`1.System#Threading#Tasks#Dataflow#ITargetBlock{T}#OfferMessage(System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.DataflowMessage{`0},System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.ISourceBlock{`0},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Offers a message to the , giving the target the opportunity to consume or postpone the message.
member.param: The being offered.
The offering the message. This may be null (Nothing in Visual Basic).

true if the target must call ConsumeMessage synchronously during the call to OfferMessage, prior to returning , in order to consume the message. false if the target wanting to accept the message should not call ConsumeMessage, and should isntead simply return DataflowMessageStatus.Accepted.
member.returns: The status of the offered message. If the message was accepted by the target, is returned, and the source should no longer use the offered message, as it is now owned by the target. If the message was postponed by the target, is returned as a notification that the target may later attempt to consume or reserve the message; in the meantime, the source still owns the message and may offer it to other blocks. If the target would have otherwise postponed but source was null, is instead returned. If the target tried to accept the message but missed it due to the source delivering the message to another target or simply discarding it, is returned. If the target chose not to accept the message, is returned. If the target chose not to accept the message and will never accept another message from this source, is returned.
member.exception: The is null (Nothing in Visual Basic).
may only be true if provided with a non-null .

member.summary: Gets a Task that represents the asynchronous operation and completion of the dataflow block.
member.remarks: A dataflow block is considered completed when it is not currently processing a message and when it has guaranteed that it will not process any more messages. The returned Task will transition to a completed state when the associated block has completed. It will transition to the RanToCompletion state when the block completes its processing successfully according to the dataflow block’s defined semantics, it will transition to the Faulted state when the dataflow block has completed processing prematurely due to an unhandled exception, and it will transition to the Canceled state when the dataflow block has completed processing prematurely due to receiving a cancellation request. If the task completes in the Faulted state, its Exception property will return an containing the one or more exceptions that caused the block to fail.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.Internal.TargetRegistry`1.NopLinkPropagator.System#Threading#Tasks#Dataflow#ITargetBlock{T}#OfferMessage(System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.DataflowMessage{`0},System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.ISourceBlock{`0},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Offers a message to the , giving the target the opportunity to consume or postpone the message.
member.param: The being offered.
The offering the message. This may be null (Nothing in Visual Basic).

true if the target must call ConsumeMessage synchronously during the call to OfferMessage, prior to returning , in order to consume the message. false if the target wanting to accept the message should not call ConsumeMessage, and should isntead simply return DataflowMessageStatus.Accepted.
member.returns: The status of the offered message. If the message was accepted by the target, is returned, and the source should no longer use the offered message, as it is now owned by the target. If the message was postponed by the target, is returned as a notification that the target may later attempt to consume or reserve the message; in the meantime, the source still owns the message and may offer it to other blocks. If the target would have otherwise postponed but source was null, is instead returned. If the target tried to accept the message but missed it due to the source delivering the message to another target or simply discarding it, is returned. If the target chose not to accept the message, is returned. If the target chose not to accept the message and will never accept another message from this source, is returned.
member.exception: The is null (Nothing in Visual Basic).
may only be true if provided with a non-null .

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.Internal.TargetRegistry`1.NopLinkPropagator.System#Threading#Tasks#Dataflow#ITargetBlock{T}#Post(`0)
member.summary: Posts an item to the .
member.param: The item being offered to the target.
member.returns: true if the item was accepted by the target block; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method will return once the target block has decided to accept or decline the item, but unless otherwise dictated by special semantics of the target block, it does not wait for the item to actually be processed (for example, will return from Post as soon as it's stored the posted item into its input queue). For target blocks that support postponing offered messages, or for blocks that may do more processing in their Post implementation, consider using PostAsync, which will return immediately and will enable the target to postpone the posted message and later consume it after PostAsync returns.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.Internal.TargetCore`1.Post(`0)
member.summary: Posts an item to the .
member.param: The item being offered to the target.
member.returns: true if the item was accepted by the target block; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method will return once the target block has decided to accept or decline the item, but unless otherwise dictated by special semantics of the target block, it does not wait for the item to actually be processed (for example, will return from Post as soon as it's stored the posted item into its input queue). For target blocks that support postponing offered messages, or for blocks that may do more processing in their Post implementation, consider using PostAsync, which will return immediately and will enable the target to postpone the posted message and later consume it after PostAsync returns.

member.summary: Signals to the that it should not accept any more messages nor consume any more postponed messages.
member.remarks: After DeclinePermanently has been called on a dataflow target block, that block will complete (such that its CompletionTask will enter a final state) after it's processed all previously provided data.

member.summary: Offers a message to the , giving the target the opportunity to consume or postpone the message.
member.param: The being offered.
The offering the message. This may be null (Nothing in Visual Basic).

true if the target must call ConsumeMessage synchronously during the call to OfferMessage, prior to returning , in order to consume the message. false if the target wanting to accept the message should not call ConsumeMessage, and should isntead simply return DataflowMessageStatus.Accepted.
member.returns: The status of the offered message. If the message was accepted by the target, is returned, and the source should no longer use the offered message, as it is now owned by the target. If the message was postponed by the target, is returned as a notification that the target may later attempt to consume or reserve the message; in the meantime, the source still owns the message and may offer it to other blocks. If the target would have otherwise postponed but source was null, is instead returned. If the target tried to accept the message but missed it due to the source delivering the message to another target or simply discarding it, is returned. If the target chose not to accept the message, is returned. If the target chose not to accept the message and will never accept another message from this source, is returned.

may only be true if provided with a non-null .

member.name: P:System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.Internal.TargetCore`1.CompletionTask
member.summary: Gets a Task that represents the asynchronous operation and completion of the dataflow block.
member.remarks: A dataflow block is considered completed when it is not currently processing a message and when it has guaranteed that it will not process any more messages. The returned Task will transition to a completed state when the associated block has completed. It will transition to the RanToCompletion state when the block completes its processing successfully according to the dataflow block’s defined semantics, it will transition to the Faulted state when the dataflow block has completed processing prematurely due to an unhandled exception, and it will transition to the Canceled state when the dataflow block has completed processing prematurely due to receiving a cancellation request. If the task completes in the Faulted state, its Exception property will return an containing the one or more exceptions that caused the block to fail.

member.summary: Gets a Task that represents the asynchronous operation and completion of the dataflow block.
member.remarks: A dataflow block is considered completed when it is not currently processing a message and when it has guaranteed that it will not process any more messages. The returned Task will transition to a completed state when the associated block has completed. It will transition to the RanToCompletion state when the block completes its processing successfully according to the dataflow block’s defined semantics, it will transition to the Faulted state when the dataflow block has completed processing prematurely due to an unhandled exception, and it will transition to the Canceled state when the dataflow block has completed processing prematurely due to receiving a cancellation request. If the task completes in the Faulted state, its Exception property will return an containing the one or more exceptions that caused the block to fail.

is immutable and can only be configured through its constructors. When specific configuration options are not accepted by the constructor, the following defaults are used:
Options Default
TaskScheduler
MaxDegreeOfParallelism 1
MaxMessagesPerTask DataflowBlockOptions.UnboundedMessagesPerTask (-1)
CancellationToken
Greedy true

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.TransformManyBlock`2.Post(`0)
member.summary: Posts an item to the .
member.param: The item being offered to the target.
member.returns: true if the item was accepted by the target block; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method will return once the target block has decided to accept or decline the item, but unless otherwise dictated by special semantics of the target block, it does not wait for the item to actually be processed (for example, will return from Post as soon as it's stored the posted item into its input queue). For target blocks that support postponing offered messages, or for blocks that may do more processing in their Post implementation, consider using PostAsync, which will return immediately and will enable the target to postpone the posted message and later consume it after PostAsync returns.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.TransformManyBlock`2.DeclinePermanently
member.summary: Signals to the that it should not accept any more messages nor consume any more postponed messages.
member.remarks: After DeclinePermanently has been called on a dataflow target block, that block will complete (such that its CompletionTask will enter a final state) after it's processed all previously provided data.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.TransformManyBlock`2.System#Threading#Tasks#Dataflow#ITargetBlock{TInput}#OfferMessage(System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.DataflowMessage{`0},System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.ISourceBlock{`0},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Offers a message to the , giving the target the opportunity to consume or postpone the message.
member.param: The being offered.
The offering the message. This may be null (Nothing in Visual Basic).

true if the target must call ConsumeMessage synchronously during the call to OfferMessage, prior to returning , in order to consume the message. false if the target wanting to accept the message should not call ConsumeMessage, and should isntead simply return DataflowMessageStatus.Accepted.
member.returns: The status of the offered message. If the message was accepted by the target, is returned, and the source should no longer use the offered message, as it is now owned by the target. If the message was postponed by the target, is returned as a notification that the target may later attempt to consume or reserve the message; in the meantime, the source still owns the message and may offer it to other blocks. If the target would have otherwise postponed but source was null, is instead returned. If the target tried to accept the message but missed it due to the source delivering the message to another target or simply discarding it, is returned. If the target chose not to accept the message, is returned. If the target chose not to accept the message and will never accept another message from this source, is returned.
member.exception: The is null (Nothing in Visual Basic).
may only be true if provided with a non-null .

member.name: P:System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.TransformManyBlock`2.CompletionTask
member.summary: Gets a Task that represents the asynchronous operation and completion of the dataflow block.
member.remarks: A dataflow block is considered completed when it is not currently processing a message and when it has guaranteed that it will not process any more messages. The returned Task will transition to a completed state when the associated block has completed. It will transition to the RanToCompletion state when the block completes its processing successfully according to the dataflow block’s defined semantics, it will transition to the Faulted state when the dataflow block has completed processing prematurely due to an unhandled exception, and it will transition to the Canceled state when the dataflow block has completed processing prematurely due to receiving a cancellation request. If the task completes in the Faulted state, its Exception property will return an containing the one or more exceptions that caused the block to fail.

It will transition to the RanToCompletion state when the block completes its processing successfully according to the dataflow block’s defined semantics, it will transition to the Faulted state when the dataflow block has completed processing prematurely due to an unhandled exception, and it will transition to the Canceled state when the dataflow block has completed processing prematurely due to receiving a cancellation request. If the task completes in the Faulted state, its Exception property will return an containing the one or more exceptions that caused the block to fail.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.BatchBlock`1.Post(`0)
member.summary: Posts an item to the .
member.param: The item being offered to the target.
member.returns: true if the item was accepted by the target block; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method will return once the target block has decided to accept or decline the item, but unless otherwise dictated by special semantics of the target block, it does not wait for the item to actually be processed (for example, will return from Post as soon as it's stored the posted item into its input queue). For target blocks that support postponing offered messages, or for blocks that may do more processing in their Post implementation, consider using PostAsync, which will return immediately and will enable the target to postpone the posted message and later consume it after PostAsync returns.

member.remarks: After DeclinePermanently has been called on a dataflow target block, that block will complete (such that its CompletionTask will enter a final state) after it's processed all previously provided data.

member.summary: Offers a message to the , giving the target the opportunity to consume or postpone the message.
member.param: The being offered.
The offering the message. This may be null (Nothing in Visual Basic).

true if the target must call ConsumeMessage synchronously during the call to OfferMessage, prior to returning , in order to consume the message. false if the target wanting to accept the message should not call ConsumeMessage, and should isntead simply return DataflowMessageStatus.Accepted.
member.returns: The status of the offered message. If the message was accepted by the target, is returned, and the source should no longer use the offered message, as it is now owned by the target. If the message was postponed by the target, is returned as a notification that the target may later attempt to consume or reserve the message; in the meantime, the source still owns the message and may offer it to other blocks. If the target would have otherwise postponed but source was null, is instead returned. If the target tried to accept the message but missed it due to the source delivering the message to another target or simply discarding it, is returned. If the target chose not to accept the message, is returned. If the target chose not to accept the message and will never accept another message from this source, is returned.

member.name: P:System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.BatchBlock`1.CompletionTask
member.summary: Gets a Task that represents the asynchronous operation and completion of the dataflow block.
member.remarks: A dataflow block is considered completed when it is not currently processing a message and when it has guaranteed that it will not process any more messages. The returned Task will transition to a completed state when the associated block has completed. It will transition to the RanToCompletion state when the block completes its processing successfully according to the dataflow block’s defined semantics, it will transition to the Faulted state when the dataflow block has completed processing prematurely due to an unhandled exception, and it will transition to the Canceled state when the dataflow block has completed processing prematurely due to receiving a cancellation request. If the task completes in the Faulted state, its Exception property will return an containing the one or more exceptions that caused the block to fail.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.BatchBlock`1.BatchBlockTargetCore.Post(`0)
member.summary: Posts an item to the .
member.param: The item being offered to the target.
member.returns: true if the item was accepted by the target block; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method will return once the target block has decided to accept or decline the item, but unless otherwise dictated by special semantics of the target block, it does not wait for the item to actually be processed (for example, will return from Post as soon as it's stored the posted item into its input queue). For target blocks that support postponing offered messages, or for blocks that may do more processing in their Post implementation, consider using PostAsync, which will return immediately and will enable the target to postpone the posted message and later consume it after PostAsync returns.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.BatchBlock`1.BatchBlockTargetCore.OfferMessage(System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.DataflowMessage{`0},System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.ISourceBlock{`0},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Offers a message to the , giving the target the opportunity to consume or postpone the message.
member.param: The being offered.
The offering the message. This may be null (Nothing in Visual Basic).

true if the target must call ConsumeMessage synchronously during the call to OfferMessage, prior to returning , in order to consume the message. false if the target wanting to accept the message should not call ConsumeMessage, and should isntead simply return DataflowMessageStatus.Accepted.
member.returns: The status of the offered message. If the message was accepted by the target, is returned, and the source should no longer use the offered message, as it is now owned by the target. If the message was postponed by the target, is returned as a notification that the target may later attempt to consume or reserve the message; in the meantime, the source still owns the message and may offer it to other blocks. If the target would have otherwise postponed but source was null, is instead returned. If the target tried to accept the message but missed it due to the source delivering the message to another target or simply discarding it, is returned. If the target chose not to accept the message, is returned. If the target chose not to accept the message and will never accept another message from this source, is returned.
member.exception: The is null (Nothing in Visual Basic).
may only be true if provided with a non-null .

member.name: P:System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.BatchBlock`1.BatchBlockTargetCore.CompletionTask
member.summary: Gets a Task that represents the asynchronous operation and completion of the dataflow block.
member.remarks: A dataflow block is considered completed when it is not currently processing a message and when it has guaranteed that it will not process any more messages. The returned Task will transition to a completed state when the associated block has completed. It will transition to the RanToCompletion state when the block completes its processing successfully according to the dataflow block’s defined semantics, it will transition to the Faulted state when the dataflow block has completed processing prematurely due to an unhandled exception, and it will transition to the Canceled state when the dataflow block has completed processing prematurely due to receiving a cancellation request. If the task completes in the Faulted state, its Exception property will return an containing the one or more exceptions that caused the block to fail.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.DataflowBlockExtensions.PostAsync``1(System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.ITargetBlock{``0},``0)
member.summary: Asynchronously posts a message to the target message block, allowing for postponement.
member.typeparam: Specifies the type of the data to post to the target.
member.param: The target to which to post the data.
The item being offered to the target.
member.returns: A that represents the asynchronous post. If the target accepts and consumes the posted element during the call to , upon return from the call the resulting Task will be completed and its Result property will return true. If the target declines the posted element durign the call, upon return from the call the resulting Task will be completed and its Result property will return false. If the target postpones the message, the message will be buffered until such time that the target consumes or releases the posted message, at which point the Task will complete, with its Result indicating whether the message was consumed. If the target never consumes or releases the message, the returned task will never complete.
member.exception: The is null (Nothing in Visual Basic).

member.summary: Offers a message to the , giving the target the opportunity to consume or postpone the message.
member.param: The being offered.
The offering the message. This may be null (Nothing in Visual Basic).

true if the target must call ConsumeMessage synchronously during the call to OfferMessage, prior to returning , in order to consume the message. false if the target wanting to accept the message should not call ConsumeMessage, and should isntead simply return DataflowMessageStatus.Accepted.
member.returns: The status of the offered message. If the message was accepted by the target, is returned, and the source should no longer use the offered message, as it is now owned by the target. If the message was postponed by the target, is returned as a notification that the target may later attempt to consume or reserve the message; in the meantime, the source still owns the message and may offer it to other blocks. If the target would have otherwise postponed but source was null, is instead returned. If the target tried to accept the message but missed it due to the source delivering the message to another target or simply discarding it, is returned. If the target chose not to accept the message, is returned. If the target chose not to accept the message and will never accept another message from this source, is returned.

may only be true if provided with a non-null .

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.DataflowBlockExtensions.ReceiveTarget`1.System#Threading#Tasks#Dataflow#ITargetBlock{T}#Post(`0)
member.summary: Posts an item to the .
member.param: The item being offered to the target.
member.returns: true if the item was accepted by the target block; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method will return once the target block has decided to accept or decline the item, but unless otherwise dictated by special semantics of the target block, it does not wait for the item to actually be processed (for example, will return from Post as soon as it's stored the posted item into its input queue). For target blocks that support postponing offered messages, or for blocks that may do more processing in their Post implementation, consider using PostAsync, which will return immediately and will enable the target to postpone the posted message and later consume it after PostAsync returns.

member.name: P:System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.DataflowBlockExtensions.ReceiveTarget`1.System#Threading#Tasks#Dataflow#IDataflowBlock#CompletionTask
member.summary: Gets a Task that represents the asynchronous operation and completion of the dataflow block.
member.remarks: A dataflow block is considered completed when it is not currently processing a message and when it has guaranteed that it will not process any more messages. The returned Task will transition to a completed state when the associated block has completed. It will transition to the RanToCompletion state when the block completes its processing successfully according to the dataflow block’s defined semantics, it will transition to the Faulted state when the dataflow block has completed processing prematurely due to an unhandled exception, and it will transition to the Canceled state when the dataflow block has completed processing prematurely due to receiving a cancellation request. If the task completes in the Faulted state, its Exception property will return an containing the one or more exceptions that caused the block to fail.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.DataflowBlockExtensions.EncapsulatingPropagator`2.OfferMessage(System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.DataflowMessage{`0},System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.ISourceBlock{`0},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Offers a message to the , giving the target the opportunity to consume or postpone the message.
member.param: The being offered.
The offering the message. This may be null (Nothing in Visual Basic).

true if the target must call ConsumeMessage synchronously during the call to OfferMessage, prior to returning , in order to consume the message. false if the target wanting to accept the message should not call ConsumeMessage, and should isntead simply return DataflowMessageStatus.Accepted.
member.returns: The status of the offered message. If the message was accepted by the target, is returned, and the source should no longer use the offered message, as it is now owned by the target. If the message was postponed by the target, is returned as a notification that the target may later attempt to consume or reserve the message; in the meantime, the source still owns the message and may offer it to other blocks. If the target would have otherwise postponed but source was null, is instead returned. If the target tried to accept the message but missed it due to the source delivering the message to another target or simply discarding it, is returned. If the target chose not to accept the message, is returned. If the target chose not to accept the message and will never accept another message from this source, is returned.
member.exception: The is null (Nothing in Visual Basic).
may only be true if provided with a non-null .

member.name: P:System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.BatchedJoinBlock`2.CompletionTask
member.summary: Gets a Task that represents the asynchronous operation and completion of the dataflow block.
member.remarks: A dataflow block is considered completed when it is not currently processing a message and when it has guaranteed that it will not process any more messages. The returned Task will transition to a completed state when the associated block has completed. It will transition to the RanToCompletion state when the block completes its processing successfully according to the dataflow block’s defined semantics, it will transition to the Faulted state when the dataflow block has completed processing prematurely due to an unhandled exception, and it will transition to the Canceled state when the dataflow block has completed processing prematurely due to receiving a cancellation request. If the task completes in the Faulted state, its Exception property will return an containing the one or more exceptions that caused the block to fail.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.Internal.BatchedJoinBlockTarget`1.Post(`0)
member.summary: Posts an item to the .
member.param: The item being offered to the target.
member.returns: true if the item was accepted by the target block; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method will return once the target block has decided to accept or decline the item, but unless otherwise dictated by special semantics of the target block, it does not wait for the item to actually be processed (for example, will return from Post as soon as it's stored the posted item into its input queue). For target blocks that support postponing offered messages, or for blocks that may do more processing in their Post implementation, consider using PostAsync, which will return immediately and will enable the target to postpone the posted message and later consume it after PostAsync returns.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.Internal.BatchedJoinBlockTarget`1.OfferMessage(System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.DataflowMessage{`0},System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.ISourceBlock{`0},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Offers a message to the , giving the target the opportunity to consume or postpone the message.
member.param: The being offered.
The offering the message. This may be null (Nothing in Visual Basic).

true if the target must call ConsumeMessage synchronously during the call to OfferMessage, prior to returning , in order to consume the message. false if the target wanting to accept the message should not call ConsumeMessage, and should isntead simply return DataflowMessageStatus.Accepted.
member.returns: The status of the offered message. If the message was accepted by the target, is returned, and the source should no longer use the offered message, as it is now owned by the target. If the message was postponed by the target, is returned as a notification that the target may later attempt to consume or reserve the message; in the meantime, the source still owns the message and may offer it to other blocks. If the target would have otherwise postponed but source was null, is instead returned. If the target tried to accept the message but missed it due to the source delivering the message to another target or simply discarding it, is returned. If the target chose not to accept the message, is returned. If the target chose not to accept the message and will never accept another message from this source, is returned.
member.exception: The is null (Nothing in Visual Basic).
may only be true if provided with a non-null .

member.remarks: After DeclinePermanently has been called on a dataflow target block, that block will complete (such that its CompletionTask will enter a final state) after it's processed all previously provided data.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.WriteOnceBlock`1.Post(`0)
member.summary: Posts an item to the .
member.param: The item being offered to the target.
member.returns: true if the item was accepted by the target block; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method will return once the target block has decided to accept or decline the item, but unless otherwise dictated by special semantics of the target block, it does not wait for the item to actually be processed (for example, will return from Post as soon as it's stored the posted item into its input queue). For target blocks that support postponing offered messages, or for blocks that may do more processing in their Post implementation, consider using PostAsync, which will return immediately and will enable the target to postpone the posted message and later consume it after PostAsync returns.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.WriteOnceBlock`1.CompleteBlockAsync
member.summary: Asynchronously completes the block on another task.
member.remarks: This must only be called once all of the completion conditions are met. If CompleteBlockAsync is called multiple times, it may end up launching additional tasks that will end up being nops.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.WriteOnceBlock`1.CompleteBlock
member.summary: Completes the block.
member.remarks: This must only be called once all of the completion conditions are met. This may be called multiple times, but is a nop on all times beyond the first.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.WriteOnceBlock`1.DeclinePermanently
member.summary: Signals to the that it should not accept any more messages nor consume any more postponed messages.
member.remarks: After DeclinePermanently has been called on a dataflow target block, that block will complete (such that its CompletionTask will enter a final state) after it's processed all previously provided data.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.WriteOnceBlock`1.System#Threading#Tasks#Dataflow#ITargetBlock{T}#OfferMessage(System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.DataflowMessage{`0},System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.ISourceBlock{`0},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Offers a message to the , giving the target the opportunity to consume or postpone the message.
member.param: The being offered.
The offering the message. This may be null (Nothing in Visual Basic).

true if the target must call ConsumeMessage synchronously during the call to OfferMessage, prior to returning , in order to consume the message. false if the target wanting to accept the message should not call ConsumeMessage, and should isntead simply return DataflowMessageStatus.Accepted.
member.returns: The status of the offered message. If the message was accepted by the target, is returned, and the source should no longer use the offered message, as it is now owned by the target. If the message was postponed by the target, is returned as a notification that the target may later attempt to consume or reserve the message; in the meantime, the source still owns the message and may offer it to other blocks. If the target would have otherwise postponed but source was null, is instead returned. If the target tried to accept the message but missed it due to the source delivering the message to another target or simply discarding it, is returned. If the target chose not to accept the message, is returned. If the target chose not to accept the message and will never accept another message from this source, is returned.
member.exception: The is null (Nothing in Visual Basic).
may only be true if provided with a non-null .

member.name: P:System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.WriteOnceBlock`1.CompletionTask
member.summary: Gets a Task that represents the asynchronous operation and completion of the dataflow block.
member.remarks: A dataflow block is considered completed when it is not currently processing a message and when it has guaranteed that it will not process any more messages. The returned Task will transition to a completed state when the associated block has completed. It will transition to the RanToCompletion state when the block completes its processing successfully according to the dataflow block’s defined semantics, it will transition to the Faulted state when the dataflow block has completed processing prematurely due to an unhandled exception, and it will transition to the Canceled state when the dataflow block has completed processing prematurely due to receiving a cancellation request. If the task completes in the Faulted state, its Exception property will return an containing the one or more exceptions that caused the block to fail.

member.name: P:System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.JoinBlock`3.CompletionTask
member.summary: Gets a Task that represents the asynchronous operation and completion of the dataflow block.
member.remarks: A dataflow block is considered completed when it is not currently processing a message and when it has guaranteed that it will not process any more messages. The returned Task will transition to a completed state when the associated block has completed. It will transition to the RanToCompletion state when the block completes its processing successfully according to the dataflow block’s defined semantics, it will transition to the Faulted state when the dataflow block has completed processing prematurely due to an unhandled exception, and it will transition to the Canceled state when the dataflow block has completed processing prematurely due to receiving a cancellation request. If the task completes in the Faulted state, its Exception property will return an containing the one or more exceptions that caused the block to fail.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.Internal.JoinBlockTarget`1.System#Threading#Tasks#Dataflow#ITargetBlock{T}#Post(`0)
member.summary: Posts an item to the .
member.param: The item being offered to the target.
member.returns: true if the item was accepted by the target block; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method will return once the target block has decided to accept or decline the item, but unless otherwise dictated by special semantics of the target block, it does not wait for the item to actually be processed (for example, will return from Post as soon as it's stored the posted item into its input queue). For target blocks that support postponing offered messages, or for blocks that may do more processing in their Post implementation, consider using PostAsync, which will return immediately and will enable the target to postpone the posted message and later consume it after PostAsync returns.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.Internal.JoinBlockTarget`1.System#Threading#Tasks#Dataflow#ITargetBlock{T}#OfferMessage(System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.DataflowMessage{`0},System.Threading.Tasks.Dataflow.ISourceBlock{`0},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Offers a message to the , giving the target the opportunity to consume or postpone the message.
member.param: The being offered.
The offering the message. This may be null (Nothing in Visual Basic).

true if the target must call ConsumeMessage synchronously during the call to OfferMessage, prior to returning , in order to consume the message. false if the target wanting to accept the message should not call ConsumeMessage, and should isntead simply return DataflowMessageStatus.Accepted.
member.returns: The status of the offered message. If the message was accepted by the target, is returned, and the source should no longer use the offered message, as it is now owned by the target. If the message was postponed by the target, is returned as a notification that the target may later attempt to consume or reserve the message; in the meantime, the source still owns the message and may offer it to other blocks. If the target would have otherwise postponed but source was null, is instead returned. If the target tried to accept the message but missed it due to the source delivering the message to another target or simply discarding it, is returned. If the target chose not to accept the message, is returned. If the target chose not to accept the message and will never accept another message from this source, is returned.
member.exception: The is null (Nothing in Visual Basic).
may only be true if provided with a non-null .
